subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... It wouldn t, actually; the order in which characters appear in Unicode has nothing to do with the way they are sorted.  Even in ASCII, code order gives you
messageBody:
tinyallen scripsit:
> Big question: Do we need to change the alphabetic order of QuickScript?
>
> If so, this would impact the Unicode submission.

It wouldn't, actually; the order in which characters appear in Unicode has
nothing to do with the way they are sorted. Even in ASCII, code order
gives you Z before a. There is a separate standard defining sorting
order, which is adjustable per language (in English, a-diaeresis sorts
with a, whereas in Swedish it sorts after z).

--
John Cowan http://ccil.org/~cowan cowan@...
There are books that are at once excellent and boring. Those that at
once leap to the mind are Thoreau's Walden, Emerson's Essays, George
Eliot's Adam Bede, and Landor's Dialogues. --Somerset Maugham

tinyallen scripsit:
>    Big question: Do we need to change the alphabetic order of QuickScript?
> 
>    If so, this would impact the Unicode submission.

It wouldn't, actually; the order in which characters appear in Unicode has
nothing to do with the way they are sorted.  Even in ASCII, code order
gives you Z before a.  There is a separate standard defining sorting
order, which is adjustable per language (in English, a-diaeresis sorts
with a, whereas in Swedish it sorts after z).

--
